Plot Interaction Significance Landscape

Source: R/plot_significance_landscape.R
plot_significance_landscape.Rd

Creates a scatter plot summarizing the reproducibility and statistical significance of interaction effects across multiple stratified resampling iterations.

Usage

plot_significance_landscape(
  x,
  x_var = "mean_T_obs",
  y_var = "median_p",
  color_var = "prob_signif",
  label_var = "feature",
  label_threshold = NULL,
  point_size = 0.5
)

Arguments

x

A data frame (e.g., from `repeated_perm_diff_interaction()$aggregated`) containing at least the feature, effect size, variability, and p-value columns.

x_var

Name of the column to use on the x-axis. Default: "mean_T_obs"

y_var

Name of the column to use on the y-axis. Will be plotted as -log10(y). Default: "median_p"

color_var

Name of the column to map to color. Default: "prob_signif"

label_var

Name of the column used for labeling points. Default: "feature"

label_threshold

Optional numeric. If provided, labels features where `color_var >= threshold`. If NULL (default), no labels are shown.

point_size

Numeric value to control base font size. Default: 0.5

Value

A ggplot2 object.
